title: What's Your Summer Jam?
description: Let us know what songs you loved in summers past, and we'll let you know which song you'll love this summer.

a.descriptor: The current No. 1 song on the Hot 100—fast-rising female, white, Australian rapper getting a major assist from the hook-purveyor from last year's Icona Pop jam "I Love It."
a.share_text: My summer jam is "Fancy" by Iggy Azalea!

b.descriptor: Latest minimalist trap-pop jam from remarkably resilient pop&B star (a hitmaker since 2009) coming off winter hit "Talk Dirty"; backed by prior summer-song-supporter Snoop.
b.share_text: My summer jam is "Wiggle" by Jason Derulo!

c.descriptor: Horn-inflected urban-pop jam belted by rising starlet behind 2013's "The Way," backed by the omnipresent rapper—currently a Hot 100 No. 2, awaiting its turn on top once "Fancy" departs.
c.share_text: My summer jam is "Problem" by Ariana Grande!

d.descriptor: Latest hit by formerly invisible Scottish DJ/producer to feature his vocals—he manned the boards behind Rihanna on"We Found Love" and Florence Welch on "Sweet Nothing" but sung his own "Feel So Close" in 2012.
d.share_text: My summer jam is "Summer" by Calvin Harris!

e.content: Miranda Lambert feat. Carrie Underwood, “Somethin’ Bad”
e.descriptor: Country's answer to "No More Tears" or "Telephone"—a summit by a pair of reigning queens teaming for the first time, on a rocking song closer to Mutt Lange than Ole Opry.
e.share_text: My summer jam is "Somethin' Bad" by Miranda Lambert!

f.content: Michael Jackson, “Love Never Felt So Good”
f.descriptor: Reanimated 1983 song, penned by Paul Anka and sung by Jackson during the Thriller era, lovingly rebuilt by producer Timbaland for the Xscape project; one version features vocals by Justin Timberlake.
f.share_text: My summer jam is "Love Never Felt So Good" by Michael Jackson!

g.descriptor: Odd, three-year-old, lurching accordion-inflected rock song by a South African band that just crossed to U.S. radio this year—topped Billboard's Alternative chart in the spring, now getting picked up by top 40 radio.
g.share_text: My summer jam is "Come with Me Now" by Kongos!

h.descriptor: New single from rapper/Idol judge/pop-culture phenom with a strong summer-hit track record; its tempo, framed by a mantra-like "I still love" refrain, is ballad-like, offset by more aggressive rap verses.
h.share_text: My summer jam is "Pill n Potions" by Nicki Minaj!

i.descriptor: A very left-field hit already in Billboard's Top 10—a shimmering midtempo pop tune with African flavors, performed by Norwegian duo formerly known as Envy; has the airiness/unorthodox catchiness of Gotye.
i.share_text: My summer jam is "Am I Wrong" by Nico & Vinz!

j.descriptor: Biggest hit to date for the once emo-punk but now more poppy trio led by in-demand singer Hayley Williams; song is still bumping around the threshold of Billboard's Top 10 and rising at top 40 radio as summer starts.
j.share_text: My summer jam is "Ain't It Fun" by Paramore!

k.descriptor: Frothy tune from the megastar who's brought us several hot-weather dominators but hasn't had a big one since 2011's "Last Friday Night"; given its title, Perry appears to want some of that sweet, sweet publishing-perennial dollar.
k.share_text: My summer jam is "Birthday" by Katy Perry!

l.descriptor: A thumping, buzzing electro-club song, and the title track from an imminent album by the Swedish goddess of indie-pop teaming with the Norwegian ambient duo who've been together since EDM was "electronica."
l.share_text: My summer jam is "Do It Again" by Robyn & Röyksopp!

m.descriptor: Not Timberlake, but a remarkable facsimile—a Pharrell-produced acoustic guitar-plus-dance beats-plus-falsetto jam, from U.K. singer-songwriter leaping from his prior delicate ballads to the top 40 brass ring.
m.share_text: My summer jam is "Sing" by Ed Sheeran!

n.descriptor: Potent piano ballad and breakthrough solo hit from an operatic-voiced Brit ("the male Adele") introduced to U.S. audiences via SNL and his guest vocals on two prior dance-pop hits—one, "Latch," is also rising at pop radio.
n.share_text: My summer jam is "Stay With Me" by Sam Smith!

o.content: DJ Snake & Lil Jon, “Turn Down for What”
o.descriptor: Trap-dance smash and unlikely comeback hit from mid-'00s crunk godfather/Dave Chappelle parody subject, cannily teaming with a French electro DJ to score his first Top 10 hit in five years.
o.share_text: My summer jam is "Turn Down For What" by DJ Snake & Lil Jon!

p.descriptor: Catchy, über-indie first single from the new album by Merrill Garbus, a celebrated worldbeat-by-way-of-Connecticut artist who topped 2011's Pazz & Jop critics' poll and is unlikely to appear on top 40 radio anytime soon.
p.share_text: My summer jam is "Water Fountain" by tUnE-yArDs!

q.descriptor: Sweaty, syncopated, boudoir-ready, and acclaimed single by the now-veteran (20 years!) R&B crooner with the killer falsetto; slow to catch on at pop radio but now rising into the R&B radio Top 10—they know what's up.
q.share_text: My summer jam is "Good Kisser" by Usher!

questions.content: Which Summer 2013 jam do you like best?

choices.content: Daft Punk feat. Pharrell Williams, “Get Lucky”
Icona Pop feat. Charli XCX, “I Love It”
Robin Thicke feat. T.I. and Pharrell, “Blurred Lines”
I don't know or like any or these songs.
